definition: to invade China (referring to 19th century imperialist powers and Japan)
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: During the Sino-Japanese War, the city wall of Nanjing was greatly damaged.
sentences.chinese: 日军侵华期间，南京城墙遭到巨大破坏。

sentences.english: Militarization of Japan, leading to autarchy, and war in China.
sentences.chinese: 日本的军事化导致专制统治及侵华。

sentences.english: After Japan invaded China, she watched developments closely.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵华战争爆发后，她密切关注战局发展。

sentences.english: In the Longling City proper, there still remain many historical traces of the activities of the Japanese invasion in China.
sentences.chinese: 在龙陵城区仍保留了许多日军侵华活动的各种遗迹。

sentences.english: During the invasion period of Japan to China, Japan implemented the thorough enslavement education in the enemy-occupied area.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵华期间，在沦陷区实施了彻底的奴化教育。

sentences.english: This was the beginning of the Japanese invasion of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 这是欧洲日本侵华的开始。

sentences.english: These studies provided the Japanese with information on how to solve the problem of grain supply during the invasion.
sentences.chinese: 这两本书为日军侵华解决粮食补给提供了情报。

sentences.english: I'd say Sino-Japanese War was pointless, and simply a power grab.
sentences.chinese: 我得说侵华战争挺没意义的，它只是一场掠夺。

sentences.english: Japanese invasions after wave of young students set off a boycott of Japanese goods.
sentences.chinese: 日寇侵华后青年学生掀起抵制日货风潮。

sentences.english: There is no denying fact that Japan invaded China.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵华历史不容否定。

sentences.english: Japan militarist launched the all-sided war of invading China.
sentences.chinese: 日本军国主义者发动了全面侵华战争。

sentences.english: Belden reported the early stages of the Japanese invasion.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔登报道了日本侵华战争初期的情况。

definition: the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Pacific War between Japan and the US, 1941-1945
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
Japanese devil (common term of abuse in wartime China and in subsequent writing)
the war of 1904-1905 between Russia and Japan
